Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

[Looking for a few tech leaders, referrals are highly appreciated!]Position: Lead Software Engineer (ASP.NET Core)Company: Inument Solutions (www.inument.com) is a software outsourcing company headquartered in Singapore, with its Engineering Hub in Dhaka. We work with clients from Australia and Europe.We are looking for experienced Senior ASP.NET Core Developers to join our team. You’ll have the opportunity to work with modern technologies and build efficient, scalable software solutions for international clients.Your primary responsibility will be to design and develop robust web applications using ASP.NET Core, ReactJS, and related technologies. You must have proven experience building high-performing enterprise applications, writing clean, maintainable code, and following best development practices. Experience working both independently and within a team is essential.Job Details:* Workplace: On-site (Baridhara DOHS, Dhaka)* Working Hours: 8:30 AM – 5:30 PM (Dhaka Time), Monday to Friday* Vacancies: 2* Experience Required: 6–12 years* Salary: BDT 150,000–250,000 (Negotiable based on skills and experience)* Must-Have: Strong ASP.NET expertise, experience with AI-assisted development tools, and excellent English communication skills. Prior experience with international/outsourcing clients is preferred.Job Description:* Provides architectural guidance and best practices for modern cloud-native, web, and serverless applications using ASP.NET Core (.NET 6/7/8+).* Guides teams in leveraging AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Cursor, Copilot) for code generation, testing, and debugging—balancing productivity with code quality and maintainability.* Proficient in monitoring and diagnostics using tools such as Application Insights or OpenTelemetry.* Solid understanding of cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure), distributed systems, DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, Docker, Kubernetes, and automated testing.* Experienced in Test-Driven Development (TDD) and Domain-Driven Design (DDD).* Ability to translate complex client requirements into robust technical implementations.* Basic understanding of prompt engineering to effectively utilize large language models (LLMs) in development workflows.Additional Requirements: * Proficient in front-end technologies including ReactJS, HTML5, and CSS.* Strong communication skills to collaborate with clients and stakeholders.* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities.* Experience with other programming languages is a strong plus.How to Apply:Send your CV to jobs@inument.com with your photo and expected salary. Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

[Looking for a few tech leaders, referrals are highly appreciated!]Position: Lead Software Engineer (ASP.NET Core)Company: Inument Solutions (www.inument.com) is a software outsourcing company headquartered in Singapore, with its Engineering Hub in Dhaka. We work with clients from Australia and Europe.We are looking for experienced Senior ASP.NET Core Developers to join our team. You’ll have the opportunity to work with modern technologies and build efficient, scalable software solutions for international clients.Your primary responsibility will be to design and develop robust web applications using ASP.NET Core, ReactJS, and related technologies. You must have proven experience building high-performing enterprise applications, writing clean, maintainable code, and following best development practices. Experience working both independently and within a team is essential.Job Details:* Workplace: On-site (Baridhara DOHS, Dhaka)* Working Hours: 8:30 AM – 5:30 PM (Dhaka Time), Monday to Friday* Vacancies: 2* Experience Required: 6–12 years* Salary: BDT 150,000–250,000 (Negotiable based on skills and experience)* Must-Have: Strong ASP.NET expertise, experience with AI-assisted development tools, and excellent English communication skills. Prior experience with international/outsourcing clients is preferred.Job Description:* Provides architectural guidance and best practices for modern cloud-native, web, and serverless applications using ASP.NET Core (.NET 6/7/8+).* Guides teams in leveraging AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Cursor, Copilot) for code generation, testing, and debugging—balancing productivity with code quality and maintainability.* Proficient in monitoring and diagnostics using tools such as Application Insights or OpenTelemetry.* Solid understanding of cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure), distributed systems, DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, Docker, Kubernetes, and automated testing.* Experienced in Test-Driven Development (TDD) and Domain-Driven Design (DDD).* Ability to translate complex client requirements into robust technical implementations.* Basic understanding of prompt engineering to effectively utilize large language models (LLMs) in development workflows.Additional Requirements: * Proficient in front-end technologies including ReactJS, HTML5, and CSS.* Strong communication skills to collaborate with clients and stakeholders.* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities.* Experience with other programming languages is a strong plus.How to Apply:Send your CV to jobs@inument.com with your photo and expected salary. Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

[Looking for a few tech leaders, referrals are highly appreciated!]Position: Lead Software Engineer (ASP.NET Core)Company: Inument Solutions (www.inument.com) is a software outsourcing company headquartered in Singapore, with its Engineering Hub in Dhaka. We work with clients from Australia and Europe.We are looking for experienced Senior ASP.NET Core Developers to join our team. You’ll have the opportunity to work with modern technologies and build efficient, scalable software solutions for international clients.Your primary responsibility will be to design and develop robust web applications using ASP.NET Core, ReactJS, and related technologies. You must have proven experience building high-performing enterprise applications, writing clean, maintainable code, and following best development practices. Experience working both independently and within a team is essential.Job Details:* Workplace: On-site (Baridhara DOHS, Dhaka)* Working Hours: 8:30 AM – 5:30 PM (Dhaka Time), Monday to Friday* Vacancies: 2* Experience Required: 6–12 years* Salary: BDT 150,000–250,000 (Negotiable based on skills and experience)* Must-Have: Strong ASP.NET expertise, experience with AI-assisted development tools, and excellent English communication skills. Prior experience with international/outsourcing clients is preferred.Job Description:* Provides architectural guidance and best practices for modern cloud-native, web, and serverless applications using ASP.NET Core (.NET 6/7/8+).* Guides teams in leveraging AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Cursor, Copilot) for code generation, testing, and debugging—balancing productivity with code quality and maintainability.* Proficient in monitoring and diagnostics using tools such as Application Insights or OpenTelemetry.* Solid understanding of cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure), distributed systems, DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, Docker, Kubernetes, and automated testing.* Experienced in Test-Driven Development (TDD) and Domain-Driven Design (DDD).* Ability to translate complex client requirements into robust technical implementations.* Basic understanding of prompt engineering to effectively utilize large language models (LLMs) in development workflows.Additional Requirements: * Proficient in front-end technologies including ReactJS, HTML5, and CSS.* Strong communication skills to collaborate with clients and stakeholders.* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities.* Experience with other programming languages is a strong plus.How to Apply:Send your CV to jobs@inument.com with your photo and expected salary. Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

We work with clients from Australia and Europe.We are looking for experienced Senior ASP.NET Core Developers to join our team. You’ll have the opportunity to work with modern technologies and build efficient, scalable software solutions for international clients.Your primary responsibility will be to design and develop robust web applications using ASP.NET Core, ReactJS, and related technologies. Experience working both independently and within a team is essential.Job Details:* Workplace: On-site (Baridhara DOHS, Dhaka)* Working Hours: 8:30 AM – 5:30 PM (Dhaka Time), Monday to Friday* Vacancies: 2* Experience Required: 6–12 years* Salary: BDT 150,000–250,000 (Negotiable based on skills and experience)* Must-Have: Strong ASP.NET expertise, experience with AI-assisted development tools, and excellent English communication skills. Prior experience with international/outsourcing clients is preferred.Job Description:* Provides architectural guidance and best practices for modern cloud-native, web, and serverless applications using ASP.NET Core (.NET 6/7/8+).* Guides teams in leveraging AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Cursor, Copilot) for code generation, testing, and debugging—balancing productivity with code quality and maintainability.* Proficient in monitoring and diagnostics using tools such as Application Insights or OpenTelemetry.* Solid understanding of cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure), distributed systems, DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, Docker, Kubernetes, and automated testing.* Experienced in Test-Driven Development (TDD) and Domain-Driven Design (DDD).* Ability to translate complex client requirements into robust technical implementations.* Basic understanding of prompt engineering to effectively utilize large language models (LLMs) in development workflows.Additional Requirements: * Proficient in front-end technologies including ReactJS, HTML5, and CSS.* Strong communication skills to collaborate with clients and stakeholders.* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities.* Experience with other programming languages is a strong plus.How to Apply:Send your CV to jobs@inument.com with your photo and expected salary. Username: White Web Digital TransformationWhite Web Digital Transformation
Post Content:
🚀 "We Thought We Were Hiring Your Expertise – Not Your Time": The Mindset That Turns Technology Into Tangible ResultsThe telling phrase "We thought we were hiring your expertise – not your time" reveals a crucial dichotomy in the IT market: the difference between simply delivering projects and driving real business transformation.📊 The Current Landscape: The Gap Between Technology and ResultsRecent data shows a concerning paradox:🔹 75% of IT projects face significant delays (Standish Group, 2023)🔹 Only 40% of organizations achieve their expected benefits from digital initiatives (McKinsey, 2024)🔹 55% of IT budgets are underutilized due to misaligned solutions (Gartner, 2023)🔍 The Root Cause: Misplaced FocusAnalysis reveals three critical failures:1️⃣ Prioritizing tools over processes – 80% of cases require operational redesign before any tech implementation (Bain & Company)2️⃣ Generic solutions for specific problems – The "one-size-fits-all" trap3️⃣ Failure to translate real needs – Business pains are often not clearly articulated💡 The Value-Driven ApproachSuccessful implementations share three key traits:1️⃣ Deep diagnostics – Process mapping before technology selection2️⃣ Holistic vision – Integration of people, processes, and systems3️⃣ Strategic flexibility – Capacity for continuous adaptation⚙️ Technology as an Enabler, Not an EndPlatforms like Microsoft Power Platform and .NET stand out by:🔹 Enabling solutions tailored to business needs🔹 Facilitating critical integrations with existing ecosystems🔹 Offering controlled scalability with predictable costs📈 Measurable ImpactOrganizations adopting this approach achieve:🔹 30% reduction in operational costs (Deloitte, 2023)🔹 3x higher success rate for projects (Forrester, 2024)🔹 45% higher adoption rates by teams (IEEE, 2023)🎯 Conclusion: Beyond ImplementationTrue excellence in IT is measured by:✅ Solving real problems, not just technical delivery✅ Strategic alignment with business objectives✅ Tangible results that justify the investmentThe transformative question isn't "What technology should we use?" but "What business outcomes do we want to enable?"hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#Microsoft hashtag#PowerPlatform hashtag#powerBI hashtag#DotNet hashtag#ERP

Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

[Looking for a few tech leaders, referrals are highly appreciated!]Position: Lead Software Engineer (ASP.NET Core)Company: Inument Solutions (www.inument.com) is a software outsourcing company headquartered in Singapore, with its Engineering Hub in Dhaka. We work with clients from Australia and Europe.We are looking for experienced Senior ASP.NET Core Developers to join our team. You’ll have the opportunity to work with modern technologies and build efficient, scalable software solutions for international clients.Your primary responsibility will be to design and develop robust web applications using ASP.NET Core, ReactJS, and related technologies. You must have proven experience building high-performing enterprise applications, writing clean, maintainable code, and following best development practices. Experience working both independently and within a team is essential.Job Details:* Workplace: On-site (Baridhara DOHS, Dhaka)* Working Hours: 8:30 AM – 5:30 PM (Dhaka Time), Monday to Friday* Vacancies: 2* Experience Required: 6–12 years* Salary: BDT 150,000–250,000 (Negotiable based on skills and experience)* Must-Have: Strong ASP.NET expertise, experience with AI-assisted development tools, and excellent English communication skills. Prior experience with international/outsourcing clients is preferred.Job Description:* Provides architectural guidance and best practices for modern cloud-native, web, and serverless applications using ASP.NET Core (.NET 6/7/8+).* Guides teams in leveraging AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Cursor, Copilot) for code generation, testing, and debugging—balancing productivity with code quality and maintainability.* Proficient in monitoring and diagnostics using tools such as Application Insights or OpenTelemetry.* Solid understanding of cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure), distributed systems, DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, Docker, Kubernetes, and automated testing.* Experienced in Test-Driven Development (TDD) and Domain-Driven Design (DDD).* Ability to translate complex client requirements into robust technical implementations.* Basic understanding of prompt engineering to effectively utilize large language models (LLMs) in development workflows.Additional Requirements: * Proficient in front-end technologies including ReactJS, HTML5, and CSS.* Strong communication skills to collaborate with clients and stakeholders.* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities.* Experience with other programming languages is a strong plus.How to Apply:Send your CV to jobs@inument.com with your photo and expected salary. Username: White Web Digital TransformationWhite Web Digital Transformation
Post Content:
🚀 "We Thought We Were Hiring Your Expertise – Not Your Time": The Mindset That Turns Technology Into Tangible ResultsThe telling phrase "We thought we were hiring your expertise – not your time" reveals a crucial dichotomy in the IT market: the difference between simply delivering projects and driving real business transformation.📊 The Current Landscape: The Gap Between Technology and ResultsRecent data shows a concerning paradox:🔹 75% of IT projects face significant delays (Standish Group, 2023)🔹 Only 40% of organizations achieve their expected benefits from digital initiatives (McKinsey, 2024)🔹 55% of IT budgets are underutilized due to misaligned solutions (Gartner, 2023)🔍 The Root Cause: Misplaced FocusAnalysis reveals three critical failures:1️⃣ Prioritizing tools over processes – 80% of cases require operational redesign before any tech implementation (Bain & Company)2️⃣ Generic solutions for specific problems – The "one-size-fits-all" trap3️⃣ Failure to translate real needs – Business pains are often not clearly articulated💡 The Value-Driven ApproachSuccessful implementations share three key traits:1️⃣ Deep diagnostics – Process mapping before technology selection2️⃣ Holistic vision – Integration of people, processes, and systems3️⃣ Strategic flexibility – Capacity for continuous adaptation⚙️ Technology as an Enabler, Not an EndPlatforms like Microsoft Power Platform and .NET stand out by:🔹 Enabling solutions tailored to business needs🔹 Facilitating critical integrations with existing ecosystems🔹 Offering controlled scalability with predictable costs📈 Measurable ImpactOrganizations adopting this approach achieve:🔹 30% reduction in operational costs (Deloitte, 2023)🔹 3x higher success rate for projects (Forrester, 2024)🔹 45% higher adoption rates by teams (IEEE, 2023)🎯 Conclusion: Beyond ImplementationTrue excellence in IT is measured by:✅ Solving real problems, not just technical delivery✅ Strategic alignment with business objectives✅ Tangible results that justify the investmentThe transformative question isn't "What technology should we use?" but "What business outcomes do we want to enable?"hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#Microsoft hashtag#PowerPlatform hashtag#powerBI hashtag#DotNet hashtag#ERP

Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

Username: White Web Digital TransformationWhite Web Digital Transformation
Post Content:
🚀 "We Thought We Were Hiring Your Expertise – Not Your Time": The Mindset That Turns Technology Into Tangible ResultsThe telling phrase "We thought we were hiring your expertise – not your time" reveals a crucial dichotomy in the IT market: the difference between simply delivering projects and driving real business transformation.📊 The Current Landscape: The Gap Between Technology and ResultsRecent data shows a concerning paradox:🔹 75% of IT projects face significant delays (Standish Group, 2023)🔹 Only 40% of organizations achieve their expected benefits from digital initiatives (McKinsey, 2024)🔹 55% of IT budgets are underutilized due to misaligned solutions (Gartner, 2023)🔍 The Root Cause: Misplaced FocusAnalysis reveals three critical failures:1️⃣ Prioritizing tools over processes – 80% of cases require operational redesign before any tech implementation (Bain & Company)2️⃣ Generic solutions for specific problems – The "one-size-fits-all" trap3️⃣ Failure to translate real needs – Business pains are often not clearly articulated💡 The Value-Driven ApproachSuccessful implementations share three key traits:1️⃣ Deep diagnostics – Process mapping before technology selection2️⃣ Holistic vision – Integration of people, processes, and systems3️⃣ Strategic flexibility – Capacity for continuous adaptation⚙️ Technology as an Enabler, Not an EndPlatforms like Microsoft Power Platform and .NET stand out by:🔹 Enabling solutions tailored to business needs🔹 Facilitating critical integrations with existing ecosystems🔹 Offering controlled scalability with predictable costs📈 Measurable ImpactOrganizations adopting this approach achieve:🔹 30% reduction in operational costs (Deloitte, 2023)🔹 3x higher success rate for projects (Forrester, 2024)🔹 45% higher adoption rates by teams (IEEE, 2023)🎯 Conclusion: Beyond ImplementationTrue excellence in IT is measured by:✅ Solving real problems, not just technical delivery✅ Strategic alignment with business objectives✅ Tangible results that justify the investmentThe transformative question isn't "What technology should we use?" but "What business outcomes do we want to enable?"hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#Microsoft hashtag#PowerPlatform hashtag#powerBI hashtag#DotNet hashtag#ERP

Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

Post Content:
🚀 "We Thought We Were Hiring Your Expertise – Not Your Time": The Mindset That Turns Technology Into Tangible ResultsThe telling phrase "We thought we were hiring your expertise – not your time" reveals a crucial dichotomy in the IT market: the difference between simply delivering projects and driving real business transformation.📊 The Current Landscape: The Gap Between Technology and ResultsRecent data shows a concerning paradox:🔹 75% of IT projects face significant delays (Standish Group, 2023)🔹 Only 40% of organizations achieve their expected benefits from digital initiatives (McKinsey, 2024)🔹 55% of IT budgets are underutilized due to misaligned solutions (Gartner, 2023)🔍 The Root Cause: Misplaced FocusAnalysis reveals three critical failures:1️⃣ Prioritizing tools over processes – 80% of cases require operational redesign before any tech implementation (Bain & Company)2️⃣ Generic solutions for specific problems – The "one-size-fits-all" trap3️⃣ Failure to translate real needs – Business pains are often not clearly articulated💡 The Value-Driven ApproachSuccessful implementations share three key traits:1️⃣ Deep diagnostics – Process mapping before technology selection2️⃣ Holistic vision – Integration of people, processes, and systems3️⃣ Strategic flexibility – Capacity for continuous adaptation⚙️ Technology as an Enabler, Not an EndPlatforms like Microsoft Power Platform and .NET stand out by:🔹 Enabling solutions tailored to business needs🔹 Facilitating critical integrations with existing ecosystems🔹 Offering controlled scalability with predictable costs📈 Measurable ImpactOrganizations adopting this approach achieve:🔹 30% reduction in operational costs (Deloitte, 2023)🔹 3x higher success rate for projects (Forrester, 2024)🔹 45% higher adoption rates by teams (IEEE, 2023)🎯 Conclusion: Beyond ImplementationTrue excellence in IT is measured by:✅ Solving real problems, not just technical delivery✅ Strategic alignment with business objectives✅ Tangible results that justify the investmentThe transformative question isn't "What technology should we use?" but "What business outcomes do we want to enable?"hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#Microsoft hashtag#PowerPlatform hashtag#powerBI hashtag#DotNet hashtag#ERP

Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

[Looking for a few tech leaders, referrals are highly appreciated!]Position: Lead Software Engineer (ASP.NET Core)Company: Inument Solutions (www.inument.com) is a software outsourcing company headquartered in Singapore, with its Engineering Hub in Dhaka. We work with clients from Australia and Europe.We are looking for experienced Senior ASP.NET Core Developers to join our team. You’ll have the opportunity to work with modern technologies and build efficient, scalable software solutions for international clients.Your primary responsibility will be to design and develop robust web applications using ASP.NET Core, ReactJS, and related technologies. You must have proven experience building high-performing enterprise applications, writing clean, maintainable code, and following best development practices. Experience working both independently and within a team is essential.Job Details:* Workplace: On-site (Baridhara DOHS, Dhaka)* Working Hours: 8:30 AM – 5:30 PM (Dhaka Time), Monday to Friday* Vacancies: 2* Experience Required: 6–12 years* Salary: BDT 150,000–250,000 (Negotiable based on skills and experience)* Must-Have: Strong ASP.NET expertise, experience with AI-assisted development tools, and excellent English communication skills. Prior experience with international/outsourcing clients is preferred.Job Description:* Provides architectural guidance and best practices for modern cloud-native, web, and serverless applications using ASP.NET Core (.NET 6/7/8+).* Guides teams in leveraging AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Cursor, Copilot) for code generation, testing, and debugging—balancing productivity with code quality and maintainability.* Proficient in monitoring and diagnostics using tools such as Application Insights or OpenTelemetry.* Solid understanding of cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure), distributed systems, DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, Docker, Kubernetes, and automated testing.* Experienced in Test-Driven Development (TDD) and Domain-Driven Design (DDD).* Ability to translate complex client requirements into robust technical implementations.* Basic understanding of prompt engineering to effectively utilize large language models (LLMs) in development workflows.Additional Requirements: * Proficient in front-end technologies including ReactJS, HTML5, and CSS.* Strong communication skills to collaborate with clients and stakeholders.* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities.* Experience with other programming languages is a strong plus.How to Apply:Send your CV to jobs@inument.com with your photo and expected salary. Username: White Web Digital TransformationWhite Web Digital Transformation
Post Content:
🚀 "We Thought We Were Hiring Your Expertise – Not Your Time": The Mindset That Turns Technology Into Tangible ResultsThe telling phrase "We thought we were hiring your expertise – not your time" reveals a crucial dichotomy in the IT market: the difference between simply delivering projects and driving real business transformation.📊 The Current Landscape: The Gap Between Technology and ResultsRecent data shows a concerning paradox:🔹 75% of IT projects face significant delays (Standish Group, 2023)🔹 Only 40% of organizations achieve their expected benefits from digital initiatives (McKinsey, 2024)🔹 55% of IT budgets are underutilized due to misaligned solutions (Gartner, 2023)🔍 The Root Cause: Misplaced FocusAnalysis reveals three critical failures:1️⃣ Prioritizing tools over processes – 80% of cases require operational redesign before any tech implementation (Bain & Company)2️⃣ Generic solutions for specific problems – The "one-size-fits-all" trap3️⃣ Failure to translate real needs – Business pains are often not clearly articulated💡 The Value-Driven ApproachSuccessful implementations share three key traits:1️⃣ Deep diagnostics – Process mapping before technology selection2️⃣ Holistic vision – Integration of people, processes, and systems3️⃣ Strategic flexibility – Capacity for continuous adaptation⚙️ Technology as an Enabler, Not an EndPlatforms like Microsoft Power Platform and .NET stand out by:🔹 Enabling solutions tailored to business needs🔹 Facilitating critical integrations with existing ecosystems🔹 Offering controlled scalability with predictable costs📈 Measurable ImpactOrganizations adopting this approach achieve:🔹 30% reduction in operational costs (Deloitte, 2023)🔹 3x higher success rate for projects (Forrester, 2024)🔹 45% higher adoption rates by teams (IEEE, 2023)🎯 Conclusion: Beyond ImplementationTrue excellence in IT is measured by:✅ Solving real problems, not just technical delivery✅ Strategic alignment with business objectives✅ Tangible results that justify the investmentThe transformative question isn't "What technology should we use?" but "What business outcomes do we want to enable?"hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#Microsoft hashtag#PowerPlatform hashtag#powerBI hashtag#DotNet hashtag#ERP

Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

[Looking for a few tech leaders, referrals are highly appreciated!]Position: Lead Software Engineer (ASP.NET Core)Company: Inument Solutions (www.inument.com) is a software outsourcing company headquartered in Singapore, with its Engineering Hub in Dhaka. We work with clients from Australia and Europe.We are looking for experienced Senior ASP.NET Core Developers to join our team. You’ll have the opportunity to work with modern technologies and build efficient, scalable software solutions for international clients.Your primary responsibility will be to design and develop robust web applications using ASP.NET Core, ReactJS, and related technologies. You must have proven experience building high-performing enterprise applications, writing clean, maintainable code, and following best development practices. Experience working both independently and within a team is essential.Job Details:* Workplace: On-site (Baridhara DOHS, Dhaka)* Working Hours: 8:30 AM – 5:30 PM (Dhaka Time), Monday to Friday* Vacancies: 2* Experience Required: 6–12 years* Salary: BDT 150,000–250,000 (Negotiable based on skills and experience)* Must-Have: Strong ASP.NET expertise, experience with AI-assisted development tools, and excellent English communication skills. Prior experience with international/outsourcing clients is preferred.Job Description:* Provides architectural guidance and best practices for modern cloud-native, web, and serverless applications using ASP.NET Core (.NET 6/7/8+).* Guides teams in leveraging AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Cursor, Copilot) for code generation, testing, and debugging—balancing productivity with code quality and maintainability.* Proficient in monitoring and diagnostics using tools such as Application Insights or OpenTelemetry.* Solid understanding of cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure), distributed systems, DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, Docker, Kubernetes, and automated testing.* Experienced in Test-Driven Development (TDD) and Domain-Driven Design (DDD).* Ability to translate complex client requirements into robust technical implementations.* Basic understanding of prompt engineering to effectively utilize large language models (LLMs) in development workflows.Additional Requirements: * Proficient in front-end technologies including ReactJS, HTML5, and CSS.* Strong communication skills to collaborate with clients and stakeholders.* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities.* Experience with other programming languages is a strong plus.How to Apply:Send your CV to jobs@inument.com with your photo and expected salary. Username: White Web Digital TransformationWhite Web Digital Transformation
Post Content:
🚀 "We Thought We Were Hiring Your Expertise – Not Your Time": The Mindset That Turns Technology Into Tangible ResultsThe telling phrase "We thought we were hiring your expertise – not your time" reveals a crucial dichotomy in the IT market: the difference between simply delivering projects and driving real business transformation.📊 The Current Landscape: The Gap Between Technology and ResultsRecent data shows a concerning paradox:🔹 75% of IT projects face significant delays (Standish Group, 2023)🔹 Only 40% of organizations achieve their expected benefits from digital initiatives (McKinsey, 2024)🔹 55% of IT budgets are underutilized due to misaligned solutions (Gartner, 2023)🔍 The Root Cause: Misplaced FocusAnalysis reveals three critical failures:1️⃣ Prioritizing tools over processes – 80% of cases require operational redesign before any tech implementation (Bain & Company)2️⃣ Generic solutions for specific problems – The "one-size-fits-all" trap3️⃣ Failure to translate real needs – Business pains are often not clearly articulated💡 The Value-Driven ApproachSuccessful implementations share three key traits:1️⃣ Deep diagnostics – Process mapping before technology selection2️⃣ Holistic vision – Integration of people, processes, and systems3️⃣ Strategic flexibility – Capacity for continuous adaptation⚙️ Technology as an Enabler, Not an EndPlatforms like Microsoft Power Platform and .NET stand out by:🔹 Enabling solutions tailored to business needs🔹 Facilitating critical integrations with existing ecosystems🔹 Offering controlled scalability with predictable costs📈 Measurable ImpactOrganizations adopting this approach achieve:🔹 30% reduction in operational costs (Deloitte, 2023)🔹 3x higher success rate for projects (Forrester, 2024)🔹 45% higher adoption rates by teams (IEEE, 2023)🎯 Conclusion: Beyond ImplementationTrue excellence in IT is measured by:✅ Solving real problems, not just technical delivery✅ Strategic alignment with business objectives✅ Tangible results that justify the investmentThe transformative question isn't "What technology should we use?" but "What business outcomes do we want to enable?"hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#Microsoft hashtag#PowerPlatform hashtag#powerBI hashtag#DotNet hashtag#ERP

Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

Post Content:
🚀 "We Thought We Were Hiring Your Expertise – Not Your Time": The Mindset That Turns Technology Into Tangible ResultsThe telling phrase "We thought we were hiring your expertise – not your time" reveals a crucial dichotomy in the IT market: the difference between simply delivering projects and driving real business transformation.📊 The Current Landscape: The Gap Between Technology and ResultsRecent data shows a concerning paradox:🔹 75% of IT projects face significant delays (Standish Group, 2023)🔹 Only 40% of organizations achieve their expected benefits from digital initiatives (McKinsey, 2024)🔹 55% of IT budgets are underutilized due to misaligned solutions (Gartner, 2023)🔍 The Root Cause: Misplaced FocusAnalysis reveals three critical failures:1️⃣ Prioritizing tools over processes – 80% of cases require operational redesign before any tech implementation (Bain & Company)2️⃣ Generic solutions for specific problems – The "one-size-fits-all" trap3️⃣ Failure to translate real needs – Business pains are often not clearly articulated💡 The Value-Driven ApproachSuccessful implementations share three key traits:1️⃣ Deep diagnostics – Process mapping before technology selection2️⃣ Holistic vision – Integration of people, processes, and systems3️⃣ Strategic flexibility – Capacity for continuous adaptation⚙️ Technology as an Enabler, Not an EndPlatforms like Microsoft Power Platform and .NET stand out by:🔹 Enabling solutions tailored to business needs🔹 Facilitating critical integrations with existing ecosystems🔹 Offering controlled scalability with predictable costs📈 Measurable ImpactOrganizations adopting this approach achieve:🔹 30% reduction in operational costs (Deloitte, 2023)🔹 3x higher success rate for projects (Forrester, 2024)🔹 45% higher adoption rates by teams (IEEE, 2023)🎯 Conclusion: Beyond ImplementationTrue excellence in IT is measured by:✅ Solving real problems, not just technical delivery✅ Strategic alignment with business objectives✅ Tangible results that justify the investmentThe transformative question isn't "What technology should we use?" but "What business outcomes do we want to Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

Username: White Web Digital TransformationWhite Web Digital Transformation
Post Content:
🚀 "We Thought We Were Hiring Your Expertise – Not Your Time": The Mindset That Turns Technology Into Tangible ResultsThe telling phrase "We thought we were hiring your expertise – not your time" reveals a crucial dichotomy in the IT market: the difference between simply delivering projects and driving real business transformation.📊 The Current Landscape: The Gap Between Technology and ResultsRecent data shows a concerning paradox:🔹 75% of IT projects face significant delays (Standish Group, 2023)🔹 Only 40% of organizations achieve their expected benefits from digital initiatives (McKinsey, 2024)🔹 55% of IT budgets are underutilized due to misaligned solutions (Gartner, 2023)🔍 The Root Cause: Misplaced FocusAnalysis reveals three critical failures:1️⃣ Prioritizing tools over processes – 80% of cases require operational redesign before any tech implementation (Bain & Company)2️⃣ Generic solutions for specific problems – The "one-size-fits-all" trap3️⃣ Failure to translate real needs – Business pains are often not clearly articulated💡 The Value-Driven ApproachSuccessful implementations share three key traits:1️⃣ Deep diagnostics – Process mapping before technology selection2️⃣ Holistic vision – Integration of people, processes, and systems3️⃣ Strategic flexibility – Capacity for continuous adaptation⚙️ Technology as an Enabler, Not an EndPlatforms like Microsoft Power Platform and .NET stand out by:🔹 Enabling solutions tailored to business needs🔹 Facilitating critical integrations with existing ecosystems🔹 Offering controlled scalability with predictable costs📈 Measurable ImpactOrganizations adopting this approach achieve:🔹 30% reduction in operational costs (Deloitte, 2023)🔹 3x higher success rate for projects (Forrester, 2024)🔹 45% higher adoption rates by teams (IEEE, 2023)🎯 Conclusion: Beyond ImplementationTrue excellence in IT is measured by:✅ Solving real problems, not just technical delivery✅ Strategic alignment with business objectives✅ Tangible results that justify the investmentThe transformative question isn't "What technology should we use?" but "What business outcomes do we want to enable?"hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#Microsoft hashtag#PowerPlatform hashtag#powerBI hashtag#DotNet hashtag#ERP

Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

Username: White Web Digital TransformationWhite Web Digital Transformation
Post Content:
🚀 "We Thought We Were Hiring Your Expertise – Not Your Time": The Mindset That Turns Technology Into Tangible ResultsThe telling phrase "We thought we were hiring your expertise – not your time" reveals a crucial dichotomy in the IT market: the difference between simply delivering projects and driving real business transformation.📊 The Current Landscape: The Gap Between Technology and ResultsRecent data shows a concerning paradox:🔹 75% of IT projects face significant delays (Standish Group, 2023)🔹 Only 40% of organizations achieve their expected benefits from digital initiatives (McKinsey, 2024)🔹 55% of IT budgets are underutilized due to misaligned solutions (Gartner, 2023)🔍 The Root Cause: Misplaced FocusAnalysis reveals three critical failures:1️⃣ Prioritizing tools over processes – 80% of cases require operational redesign before any tech implementation (Bain & Company)2️⃣ Generic solutions for specific problems – The "one-size-fits-all" trap3️⃣ Failure to translate real needs – Business pains are often not clearly articulated💡 The Value-Driven ApproachSuccessful implementations share three key traits:1️⃣ Deep diagnostics – Process mapping before technology selection2️⃣ Holistic vision – Integration of people, processes, and systems3️⃣ Strategic flexibility – Capacity for continuous adaptation⚙️ Technology as an Enabler, Not an EndPlatforms like Microsoft Power Platform and .NET stand out by:🔹 Enabling solutions tailored to business needs🔹 Facilitating critical integrations with existing ecosystems🔹 Offering controlled scalability with predictable costs📈 Measurable ImpactOrganizations adopting this approach achieve:🔹 30% reduction in operational costs (Deloitte, 2023)🔹 3x higher success rate for projects (Forrester, 2024)🔹 45% higher adoption rates by teams (IEEE, 2023)🎯 Conclusion: Beyond ImplementationTrue excellence in IT is measured by:✅ Solving real problems, not just technical delivery✅ Strategic alignment with business objectives✅ Tangible results that justify the investmentThe transformative question isn't "What technology should we use?" but "What business outcomes do we want to enable?"hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#Microsoft hashtag#PowerPlatform hashtag#powerBI hashtag#DotNet hashtag#ERP

Steps to Write an xUnit Test Case1️⃣ Install xUnit NuGet packagesIn your test project, install:xunitxunit.runner.visualstudioMicrosoft.NET.Test.Sdkbashdotnet add package xunitdotnet add package xunit.runner.visualstudiodotnet add package Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk2️⃣Create a test projectIf you haven’t already:dotnet new xunit -n MyProject.Tests3️⃣ Write the test classTest classes can be public.No need for [TestClass] (xUnit doesn’t use that).Mark each test method with [Fact] (or [Theory] for parameterized tests).Tips: Use Fact for simple tests with no parameters. Use Theory + InlineData for parameterized tests. Use Assert.Throws for testing exceptions. Follow AAA pattern: Arrange → Act → Assert. Name your tests clearly: MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#SqlServer hashtag#AdoDotNet hashtag#AspDotNetCore hashtag#WebApi hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#Fresher hashtag#BengaluruTech hashtag#Bengaluru hashtag#OpenToNetWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftWare hashtag#MicroSoftDeveloper hashtag#Developer hashtag#Linkedin hashtag#BackEndDeveloper

[Looking for a few tech leaders, referrals are highly appreciated!]Position: Lead Software Engineer (ASP.NET Core)Company: Inument Solutions (www.inument.com) is a software outsourcing company headquartered in Singapore, with its Engineering Hub in Dhaka. We work with clients from Australia and Europe.We are looking for experienced Senior ASP.NET Core Developers to join our team. You’ll have the opportunity to work with modern technologies and build efficient, scalable software solutions for international clients.Your primary responsibility will be to design and develop robust web applications using ASP.NET Core, ReactJS, and related technologies. You must have proven experience building high-performing enterprise applications, writing clean, maintainable code, and following best development practices. Experience working both independently and within a team is essential.Job Details:* Workplace: On-site (Baridhara DOHS, Dhaka)* Working Hours: 8:30 AM – 5:30 PM (Dhaka Time), Monday to Friday* Vacancies: 2* Experience Required: 6–12 years* Salary: BDT 150,000–250,000 (Negotiable based on skills and experience)* Must-Have: Strong ASP.NET expertise, experience with AI-assisted development tools, and excellent English communication skills. Prior experience with international/outsourcing clients is preferred.Job Description:* Provides architectural guidance and best practices for modern cloud-native, web, and serverless applications using ASP.NET Core (.NET 6/7/8+).* Guides teams in leveraging AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Cursor, Copilot) for code generation, testing, and debugging—balancing productivity with code quality and maintainability.* Proficient in monitoring and diagnostics using tools such as Application Insights or OpenTelemetry.* Solid understanding of cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure), distributed systems, DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, Docker, Kubernetes, and automated testing.* Experienced in Test-Driven Development (TDD) and Domain-Driven Design (DDD).* Ability to translate complex client requirements into robust technical implementations.* Basic understanding of prompt engineering to effectively utilize large language models (LLMs) in development workflows.Additional Requirements: * Proficient in front-end technologies including ReactJS, HTML5, and CSS.* Strong communication skills to collaborate with clients and stakeholders.* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities.* Experience with other programming languages is a strong plus.How to Apply:Send your CV to jobs@inument.com with your photo and expected salary. Username: White Web Digital TransformationWhite Web Digital Transformation
Post Content:
🚀 "We Thought We Were Hiring Your Expertise – Not Your Time": The Mindset That Turns Technology Into Tangible ResultsThe telling phrase "We thought we were hiring your expertise – not your time" reveals a crucial dichotomy in the IT market: the difference between simply delivering projects and driving real business transformation.📊 The Current Landscape: The Gap Between Technology and ResultsRecent data shows a concerning paradox:🔹 75% of IT projects face significant delays (Standish Group, 2023)🔹 Only 40% of organizations achieve their expected benefits from digital initiatives (McKinsey, 2024)🔹 55% of IT budgets are underutilized due to misaligned solutions (Gartner, 2023)🔍 The Root Cause: Misplaced FocusAnalysis reveals three critical failures:1️⃣ Prioritizing tools over processes – 80% of cases require operational redesign before any tech implementation (Bain & Company)2️⃣ Generic solutions for specific problems – The "one-size-fits-all" trap3️⃣ Failure to translate real needs – Business pains are often not clearly articulated💡 The Value-Driven ApproachSuccessful implementations share three key traits:1️⃣ Deep diagnostics – Process mapping before technology selection2️⃣ Holistic vision – Integration of people, processes, and systems3️⃣ Strategic flexibility – Capacity for continuous adaptation⚙️ Technology as an Enabler, Not an EndPlatforms like Microsoft Power Platform and .NET stand out by:🔹 Enabling solutions tailored to business needs🔹 Facilitating critical integrations with existing ecosystems🔹 Offering controlled scalability with predictable costs📈 Measurable ImpactOrganizations adopting this approach achieve:🔹 30% reduction in operational costs (Deloitte, 2023)🔹 3x higher success rate for projects (Forrester, 2024)🔹 45% higher adoption rates by teams (IEEE, 2023)🎯 Conclusion: Beyond ImplementationTrue excellence in IT is measured by:✅ Solving real problems, not just technical delivery✅ Strategic alignment with business objectives✅ Tangible results that justify the investmentThe transformative question isn't "What technology should we use?" but "What business outcomes do we want to enable?"hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#Microsoft hashtag#PowerPlatform hashtag#powerBI hashtag#DotNet hashtag#ERP
